quest.name: Big Trouble in Little Ala Mhigo
journal: Gundobald needs your help to rein in the young ones of Little Ala Mhigo.

Gundobald has scarcely opened his mouth when the battered and bruised figure of Bertliana stumbles back into Little Ala Mhigo. Through choked sobs, she reveals that she was being held captive by the Corpse Brigade. Fearing that this incident may spur Wilred and the others to action, Gundobald bids you go to them and see that they do not do something they may later regret.
To your dismay, it would seem that Wilred and his friends have already set their plan in motion. Hurry back to Gundobald and show him the blunt hunting knife and the Zanr'ak map you have found.

It seems that Wilred and his friends have been plotting to summon Rhalgr. To this end, they seek to infiltrate an Amalj'aa stronghold and steal the beastmen's cache of crystals. Intercept Wilred and his conspirators to the east of Little Ala Mhigo before the unthinkable comes to pass.
Wilred's plan has come to naught, as have his hopes of reclaiming his homeland. Return to Little Ala Mhigo and speak with Gundobald.

Wilred reveals that it was the masked stranger who first prompted him and his friends to entertain the notion of summoning Rhalgr. But what did Lahabrea─if indeed it was he─hope to accomplish by putting great power in the hands of the unworthy?

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Wilred mentioned obtaining the power to bring down the Empire. Of what power could he be speaking...?

dialogue.name: BERTLIANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Gun...Gundobald... <groan> I-I...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Bertliana!? Gods preserve! What happened!?

dialogue.name: BERTLIANA
dialogue.text: I was out foraging...when the Corpse Brigade came... They took me to their hideout...and they...they... <sob>

dialogue.name: BERTLIANA
dialogue.text:
The whole while, they laughed at me... <sob> They said that I suffer...
b–because I cling on to hope... <sob>

dialogue.name: BERTLIANA
dialogue.text: Is it wrong to dream of home? Is it wrong to call ourselves Ala Mhigans?

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Do not heed such poisonous notions, child. Our dreams are what sustain us. Be strong─I swear to you, those villains will answer for their crimes in due time. But tell me...does anyone else know of this?

dialogue.name: BERTLIANA
dialogue.text: Wilred... He saw me outside... He was so angry...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: I must tend to Bertliana. In the meantime, I need you to find out what the young ones make of this. I fear that they may do something rash.

dialogue.name: BERTLIANA
dialogue.text: ...Don't worry about me. Just being near everyone again eases my heart...

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: O mighty Rhalgr, Lord of Destruction...we implore You, lend us Your strength and put an end to the suffering of Your people...

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: Hmph, here to interfere again? Well, you're too late. Our plan is already in motion.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: Once we have the crystals, our enemies will pay for their crimes, and no one will dare oppress us ever again!

dialogue.name: NPCA
dialogue.text: What those animals did to Bertliana is unforgivable! And to think they look down on us!

dialogue.name: NPCA
dialogue.text: Well, I'll suffer this humiliation no more! I'm with Wilred to the bitter end! I'm not afraid of a few lizards!

dialogue.name: NPCB
dialogue.text: If this plan succeeds, we'll have the power to lay the Empire low! To change the world for the better!

dialogue.name: NPCB
dialogue.text: Might be as Gundobald's content to eke out an existence in this musty old cave, but I'll be damned if I'm going to spend the rest of my life here. Now, where in the seven hells did I put that bloody map?

dialogue.name: DUMMY
dialogue.text: (Map of Zanr'ak)

dialogue.name: DUMMY
dialogue.text: (Hunting Knife)

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: ...Gone? The whole lot of them? Then it is as I feared─they mean to take matters into their own hands. But what exactly is it that they mean to do?

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: What's this? A hunting knife...and a map of Zanr'ak? ...Wait. You said Wilred spoke of crystals, did you not? But they couldn't possibly mean to─ By the gods, this is rank madness...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: The young fools are untrained and unblooded, all. They have no notion of how dangerous the Amalj'aa are. They'll be butchered before they get within a hundred yalms of the crystals.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: They are headed east. If we hurry, we may yet find them before it's too late.

dialogue.name: NPCA
dialogue.text: M-Mercy! Please don't kill me!

dialogue.name: NPCA
dialogue.text: Wh-What went wrong? It was supposed to be easy! Damn it all to the seven hells!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Wilred... Did no others survive?

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: This is all wrong... Getting the crystals was supposed to be the start... We were going to reclaim our homeland... We were... We...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Pull yourself together, lad!

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: W-We were going to make an offering of crystals to Rhalgr─to summon Him, j-just like the masked man taught us.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: We plotted to sneak into Zanr'ak and make off with the lizardmen's cache, b-but they caught us and...and... So many dead... Gods forgive me...

dialogue.name: AMALJAA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Heathens! You shall pay for your crimes with your souls!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: I regret our young ones' transgressions, but a soul is too high a price for youthful folly.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: For all their failings, they are the hope of the Ala Mhigan people. This hope I will guard with my life.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Your skill at arms is impressive, adventurer. Our wayward youths could learn much from a womanman like you.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: The battle is won, but it would be unwise to linger here. Let us return to Little Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: W-Wait! We've come all this way─we have to get the crystals! They're right there, ripe for the picking!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Have you learned nothing, Wilred? Did you not see those tempered wretches?

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Such is the fate of those who are touched by a god. Is that what you desire for yourself and your friends?

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: What!? N-No one said anything about─ The masked man told us we could defeat the Empire if we summoned Rhalgr! He swore─

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Enough. I will hear the rest of this sorry tale back in Little Ala Mhigo. I daresay Forename will wish to hear it as well.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: No more lies, Wilred. Tell us everything.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: I was outside with the others when he appeared─the masked stranger.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: He told us about summoning Rhalgr, about using crystals, and then just...vanished. We never saw him again.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: I wanted so desperately to believe that we could raise ourselves from this squalor that I never stopped to question his motives. But I should have known─there's no solution, nothing we can do to change our lot. Our people are doomed to live and die like beasts...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Listen to me, Wilred. Our home may be lost to us, but it takes more than stones and mortar to define who we are. No matter where we may be, Ala Mhigo lives on within us all.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: It is for you to decide what to make of this legacy. But whatever you choose to do with your life, never forget that you owe it to this adventurer─an outsider.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: I...I won't. I promise.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: Thank you for saving me. And...sorry I tried to kill you.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: My thanks as well, friend. It gives us hope to know that there are kind souls such as you out there. Little Ala Mhigo may not have much in the way of comfort, but you will always be welcome here.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Protect Wilred and defeat the Amalj'aa!

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: Forgive us... We...we only wanted...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: The excuses will keep!

dialogue.name: AMALJABOSS
dialogue.text: The whelps must pay for their crimes!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: I will not let you harm them!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Adventurer, stay close to Wilred!

dialogue.name: AMALJABOSS
dialogue.text: Come, ye blessed of our Lord's breath!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: We almost have them!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Urgh... Is this...it?

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: It wasn't meant to end...like this...

dialogue.name: YOUNGMAN
dialogue.text: No! I don't want to die!

dialogue.name: YOUNGMAN
dialogue.text: Mummy!!!
